properties.Description: The Nehalem River empties into the Pacific. This area contains large stretches of estuary and tidal wetland.
Vernonia is the largest human settlement in the Upper Nehalem near to the source of the river.
Large woody deposits (LWD) simulate the normal progession of old growth trees into salmon habitat. Logs can provide safe harbor for rearing salmon.
Beaver dam analogues can imitate some of the benefits provided by beavers. In addition, they may attract beavers to enter the area and create real dams.
The lower Nehalem contains steeper terrain and more waterfalls- which will not deter salmon from going upstream to their spawning grounds.
Fishing is an important recreational and economic activity in the watershed. Fortunately, federal and state protection means this is not a major threat to salmon populations.
Beavers are an important keystone species in watershed function.
Juvenile salmon prefer shallow, slow moving, cold water refuges.
The logging industry has had huge impacts on the landscape of the Nehalem basin. To this day, large swaths of the region are owned and operated by private logging companies.
